availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John L. Dorsey (Fleming County, Kentucky, sheriff and soldier)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer, deputy sheriff, and soldier. Fleming County, Kentucky, native. Son of Joseph Dorsey and Arra Dorsey. Student in Fleming County in 1850. Deputy sheriff in Fleming County in 1860. Enlisted in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private on October 12, 1861. Discharged on virtue of enlistment as veteran volunteer on December 31, 1863. Mustered back in the 16th Kentucky on January 1, 1864. Wounded in action at Columbia, Tennessee, on November 29, 1864 and sent to hospital, where he also served as a nurse in the No. 19 U. S. A. General Hospital, Nashville, Tennessee, from November 30, 1864, to February 1865. Mustered out on July 15, 1865

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 345B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg (District 2), p. 636.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Rolls 0290 and 0487.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 628-29.
